attributes.action: Only allow reducted sentences for those prisoners who plead guilty immediately.
attributes.background: Prisoners have their sentence reduced by a third if they admit their guilt at the 'first opportunity'. In practice they receive this reduction even if they wait until court to plead guilty - wasting vast amounts of police time. This reduction should only be for those who admit guilt before charge.

attributes.action: Petition for Flower Of Scotland to be the national anthem of Scotland.
attributes.background:
"There is no official national anthem of Scotland."

The Flower of Scotland should be the national anthem of Scotland, representing this nation.

attributes.action: Limit the time MP's can talk during a debate to stop the practice Fillabustering
attributes.background: The practice of "fillabustering" is an unfair practice used by opposition members to waste time during a Private Members Bill debate and therefore delay or entirely prevent a vote on the proposal.  We demand that time for any one member to talk during a debate on a bill is limited.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-18784131

attributes.action: Ex Pats should not be allowed to vote in the upcoming EU Referendum
attributes.background: Ex pats that have lived outside the UK for over 15 years should not be given a vote in the upcoming referendum. They have decided to live outside the UK and should not have a say in this important vote that affects those that live in the United Kingdom.
attributes.additional_details: With Ex Pats creating a future court case, the government is urged to not allow a vote from those living outside the UK for over 15 years. Such votes are likely to be biased and not a true reflection on those who reside in the United Kingdom.

attributes.action: Ban Barack Obama from UK for  remarks about the UK handling of  Libyan conflict.
attributes.background: Recent reports where American President Barack Obama has made derogatory remarks of the British and French governments involvement and poor performance in relation to the Libyan conflict.

attributes.action: National Travel Ban on Foreign Anti-gay Officials
attributes.background: Senator Jeane Shaheen recently introduced legislation that would deny entry into the United States to non-citizens who are involved in the persecution of LGBTI people around the world. I believe this is a fantastic idea and believe the UK should have this in place also.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.gaystarnews.com/article/us-democrats-propose-national-travel-ban-on-foreign-anti-gay-officials/#gs.GCsU1ko

attributes.action: Make government create a Bank of England national high street bank.
attributes.background:
I think the public should have an option to borrow/have mortgage from a private bank or to borrow from a national bank run and owned by government.         
I'd rather borrow from my own country's national bank and pay back with interest, instead of borrowing from foreign owned private banks.
attributes.additional_details:
I think the British public have a right to borrow/have mortgage from government. The Bank of England should have a branch in every high street. 
A national bank created just for small buissness/mortgage borrowing and basic current accounts.
Private banks profit billions pay their Chiefs millions and get bailed out by the public when they get it all wrong.
A nationally owned bank I think would help keep private banks in order.

attributes.action: Start to plan real strategy to deal with Donald Trump as President.
attributes.background: The USA could well be run by Donald Trump in 2017, he, his policies and his supporters are the biggest threat to democracy & world security in the 21st century. We must start planning for this possible outcome and distance ourselves from the United States of America.
attributes.additional_details:
Should Trump become President we should...

Stop buying US:
Weapons;
Goods;
Services; &
Oil (crude)

Remove:
US ran military bases in the UK and vote to remove them across the EU; &
Agreements to use UK airspace / airfields for US military (airforce, army, navy, et al)

Veto:
All US led UN war resolutions; &
All UN tabled resolutions that could result in an outbreak of war or invasion by the US or UN.

attributes.action: Britain must evacuate all children from the refugee camps in Northern France.
attributes.background:
Evacuate every child under the age of 16, effective immediately. 
These are innocent children. They must be saved.

There are lots of compassionate people in the UK, willing to take on a refugee child. We will literally open up our front doors. Our towns, villages, cities. Our homes.
attributes.additional_details:
This is not a topic that we should even be discussing. As a nation of good people. We see that there must be ways to house, feed and most importantly educate these children who are currently living in terrible and life threatening conditions in Northern France. We cannot stand by and watch them die. There are spare beds here. 

This is the opportunity to do the right thing, as a nation, united. 

Remember the Kindertransport. Lives saved.

We, the undersigned, will foster a refugee child

attributes.action: Want equal shares in profits in houses if a couple divorce with children
attributes.background: I recently went through a divorce and when when me and my ex wife separated it was me who left the house as my children x2 needed a home, so therefore it was better for me to leave. Once we got to court the judge awarded a 70/30 split in the house profits in favour of my ex wife. It seems unfair.
attributes.additional_details: I really think this law needs changing as my question is - What is that other 20% actually gaining for my children? Who is the main benefactor in this? Is it the children, or is it the adults? On a house with profit with or without kids should be 50/50 split. That way then both adults can create homes, instead of the man struggling.

attributes.action: Minimum text size for "Excessive consumption may cause a laxative effect" etc.
attributes.background: Important information is often easy to overlook and can cause severe distress and discomfort.  Many sugar-free sweets, for example, are ... "incompatible" ... with a long train journey potentially without toilets.

attributes.action: Stop disabled drivers being charged for parking in on/off street car parks.
attributes.background: I recently received a parking charge notice stating that I had contravened the parking terms and conditions of a car park. Upon investigating the terms and conditions I noted that there were no disabled concessions allowed. I find this unacceptable as disabled drivers often require concession.
attributes.additional_details: The blue badge scheme was designed to facilitate disabled drivers getting closer to their destination due to their disability. Most councils have made concessions for disabled drivers to park free of charge on/off street, however it seems that privately operated car parks (which are most retail parks and supermarkets) are being allowed to waiver the concession rights of disabled drivers. I want this to change so that disabled concession of free parking applies to all on/off street parking.

attributes.action: Ban utility companies from charging existing customers more than new customers.
attributes.background: Ever had your internet/gas/electricity/insurance renewal quote come back much higher than you were paying? Wasted time phoning up just to get nowhere? Looked online to see much cheaper offers exist and spent ages switching just to have it all happen again next year? Ban this waste of time and money!
attributes.additional_details:
There is no reason why people should be charged a higher price just because they are an existing customer.
Utility companies offer cheap rates to attract new customers but they rip-off existing customers by pushing up the price each year; knowing many people won't bother switching.
Force companies to automatically roll-out the best offer available to all customers with a given profile and penalise if not done.
This wouldn't affect loyalty discounts for existing customers or no-claims bonuses.

attributes.action: Stop current MPs being either be a director or shareholder of a company.
attributes.background:
Vested business interests influencing political decision making appears to be rife and uncontrolled.
MPs having a conflict of interests to be addressed and taken extremely seriously, with consequences of hefty fines and imprisonment.

attributes.action: Make the DBS filtering system fairer for people with more than 2 convictions.
attributes.background:
People that commit more than one petty offence have to declare this to some employers on application even though their offences may be petty or recorded decades ago.
With prisoners being released early and people getting a slapped wrist for serious offences today, historical offenders stand to lose
attributes.additional_details:
Since being made redundant, my friend has been unable to get another job because 35 years ago, he took a hub cap off a dumped car and on another occasion altered a road tax disk. Employers are unlikely to offer him a job because of it. In fact, a criminal with one serious offence that has lapsed can have his/her record filtered after a period of time.
I think petty recorded crimes recorded over decades ago should be filtered also. The current system is ridiculous and discriminatory.

attributes.action: Regulate imports of clothing from unethical sources.
attributes.background: Thousands of workers in countries such as India are being exploited and being payed close to nothing for their hard work. Their work places are unsafe as shown by the Rana Plaza collapse. We want our government to help stop this and make sure garments coming in to our country are properly sourced.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2013_Savar_building_collapse

attributes.action: Stop Crossrail 2 from destroying Iconic buildings in Wimbledon town.
attributes.background: This will effect so many peoples lives during the construction phase over the next 8-10 years, as buildings, homes and companies are demolished leaving business owners scrambling for new jobs. Wimbledon would also be clogged up with traffic jams. This,ultimately will effect the future of Wimbledon.
attributes.additional_details:
At first I was excited about Crossrail 2, until the government revealed the building being demolished. 

The following are the names of companies/buildings that will be demolished:
Center Court
Waitrose
WHsmith
Tesco
M&S
H&M
Next
Waterstones
Maplins

HMV
O2

Vodaphone 
Subway

British Heart Foundation
Jacks
The Terrace 
Coral1,2 
Jennings Bet
Flight Centre
Doddle
Everyday church
Krystals

attributes.action: Lodge a complaint with the International Court of Justice against Denmark
attributes.background:
To the UK Government,
We request that the UK lodges a formal complaint with the International Court of Justice in The Hague against the Kingdom of Denmark for violating European community laws. Danish Naval vessels have assisted the hunting of small cetaceans around the Faroese coast.
attributes.additional_details:
Article 4 paragraph 3 of the Treaty of the European Union states that "The Member States have a duty of sincere cooperation and should refrain from any measure outside of EU legislation which could jeopardize the rules of the Union or its objectives".
Sea Shepherd can provide photographic and video evidence that Royal Danish Navy vessels have also assisted the Faroese police in intercepting and arresting Sea Shepherd volunteers (including from the UK) who were trying to uphold European law.

attributes.action: Call on the Government to send in the Army to protect lorry Drivers in France.
attributes.background: Due to increase on attacks to lorry drivers in Calais France before someone gets killed or serious injury to send over troops to protect the drivers and their lorries also the cost to damaged or soiled goods and maybe the destruction of businesses.

attributes.action: Stop the benefit cap November 2016.
attributes.background: the benefit cap is not being publicised it Will affect thousands of families and children and will leave people 50 pound worse off or more a week it will come directly from your housing benefit and leave people to make up the short fall.This will leave people homeless or not able to pay bills
attributes.additional_details: Please google benefit cap calculator and select November 2016 to see if you are affected

attributes.action: Limit maximum private parking charges.
attributes.background: This petition is to get a law in place to limit the maximum fine private parking companies can charge to £60 and a minimum of a 50% discount if paid within 14 days.

attributes.action: Increase the restriction speed for 50cc mopeds to 60mph
attributes.background: I use 60mph roads on a regular basis. I have found that other road users grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass at dangerous points of which could easily result in a threat on my life as some cars overtake and narrowly avoid a head on crash
attributes.additional_details: I have been riding my 50cc motorbike for a few months now and I have to use 60mph/40mph roads on a regular basis on my way to school. I have found that other road users in larger vehicles grow impatient of trailing behind me at 30mph and many find that it's a good idea to pass on corners and/or dangerously close to me. There have also been some that risk a head on crash in an attempt to pass. A faster speed in my eyes would eliminate the threat that other road users oppose to slower mopeds.

attributes.action: Lift the official secrets act 1989
attributes.background: To the house of commons, The petition of U.K Taxpayers declares that the Westminister child sex abuse enquiry is being prevented by the official secrets act 1989. The petitioners therefore urge the house of commons to lift the official secrets act 1989. And the petitioners remain.
attributes.additional_details: https://lawrenceserewicz.wordpress.com/2015/04/13/official-secrets-act-and-child-sexual-abuse-inquiry-arcana-imperii-and-the-secrets-of-state/

attributes.action: The Abolition of the Monarchy to be in effect as soon as possible
attributes.background:
We the undersigned, want to abolish the Monarchy due to many reasons.

Mainly due to them being out of touch with the majority of the public in the 21st Century, their unaccountability and constantly showing us how unequal we are in this country we call a democracy.
attributes.additional_details:
The Monarchy still retains a lot of political power for an establishment that is unelected, being able to influence our laws on a daily basis, this is well known.
The Monarch retains the powers to appoint and dismiss Prime Ministers that we elect by a democratic majority whenever they choose, the last time this happened was in 1974.
Officially, we are subjects and not citizens of this country from the day we are born.
Also, we spend far too much on the Monarchy, this money could be spent better.

attributes.action: Add safeguards to §111A (Enterprise & Regulatory Reform Act 2013) for employees.
attributes.background:
The current laws regarding 'Settlement Agreements' or 'Without Prejudice Conversations' or 'Protected Conversations' or 'Off the record Conversations' are shockingly lacking in safeguards for the employee.

They can be sprung upon an employee as a way of getting rid of them without red tape.
attributes.additional_details:
They are being used currently by employers as a way to place 'no other options decisions' on the employee and there is not enough safeguarding process to resolve relationship issues through other steps first. Much like you can't go to tribunal without a certificate from ACAS, employers should not be allowed to have these types of conversation without all possible other avenues exhausted first.

I'm not suggesting that the option shouldn't be there, it should just be limited to the final ones.

attributes.action: More rights for victims and family of victims of crime
attributes.background: Since our son James was killed in a hit and run, little if any consideration has been given to his rights or that of his family. Conversely, the rights of those responsible for James' death have been a constant course of consideration, allowing them to exercise those rights on more than 12 occasions
attributes.additional_details: The right to live and enjoy life was taken from James at 25 by the callous actions of Majid Malik and Kiaz Mahmood as they raced their cars at 90mph in a 40mph zone. Since that day the judicial system has continually provided opportunities for these serial criminals to exercise their rights, protecting them from facing the consequences of their actions. We have had no such rights, James' rights are ignored in favour of the criminals. Time for a change, it's the rights of victims that matter.

attributes.action: Strengthen Laws against Negligent Private Surgeons & Healthcare Providers
attributes.background:
Private healthcare patients are commonly led to believe that the care they are paying for will meet the highest standards. 
In cases where patients receive wrongful or negligent treatment  private healthcare patients have less access to adequate redress and compensation than NHS patients.
attributes.additional_details:
At present legislation is so insufficient that one private healthcare company actually stated in a legal defence document that they were ‘under no obligation to provide competent surgeons to perform surgery at the hospital’ and had ‘no duty to protect patients from harm, and risk of injury’.

We ask Secretary of State for Health, Jeremy Hunt  to close the legal loophole which allows for private healthcare patients to be left without protection or redress when things go wrong.

attributes.action: "Superfast" (Fibre) broadband should be made available to Exchange Only lines
attributes.background: During the current "superfast" broadband rollout, many properties are being excluded because they are not connected to roadside cabinets. When these properties were originally connected to their local telephone exchange, cabinets were not in standard use.
attributes.additional_details:
Current regulations say that the new "superfast" technology must be installed outside exchanges in cabinets. Therefore new cabinets should be installed outside existing exchanges (to comply with current regulations) or the regulations should be changed.

Currently the public money being spent on these projects is done so without public consultation. Homeowners and businesses cannot interact with the organisers implementing the projects to ensure fair distribution.

attributes.action: Introduce motorcycle licence progression training as per the 3rd EU Directive.
attributes.background: Department of Transport ignored the licence progression training in Article 7.1.c of 3rd EU Driving Licence Directive. It imposed compulsory retesting which removed all incentive for novices to train and qualify for A1. There was an 8% increase in Killed & Seriously Injured 'after' implementation.
attributes.additional_details: 17-19 year olds can ride A1 class bikes (125cc) on a CBT cert. At 19 they can take the A2 test for larger bikes. There is now no incentive to train to A1 test standard because they are forced to repeat the same tests when they are entitled to progress at 19. This essentially entices them to wait and continue on a CBT. They ride for up to 2 years without any highway code knowledge, theory test and hazard perception. CBT only gives them 2 hours road preparation. DVSA stats show a 8% KSI increase.

attributes.action: Force Manufacturers of all goods to make warranties transferable.
attributes.background: I wanted to buy a lens that's only 4 months old. The maker told me that the 12 month warranty isn't transferable and applies to the original purchaser only.  Common with consumer goods. I think they should simply have to guarantee the product for a period of time regardless of changes in ownership.

attributes.action: Remove exemptions for child seats in coaches and large minibuses
attributes.background:
Children are protected (with few exceptions) from travelling unrestrained in vehicles such as cars, vans and small minibuses.

There is no such requirement for large minibuses or coaches. The law only applies to those over the age of 14.

Children under the age of 14 are being put at risk.
attributes.additional_details:
A baby on its carer's knee is legal. This child would be at serious risk of being killed in the event of a crash. Even a simple emergency stop risks crushing injuries between the adult and the seat in front.

Coaches and large minibuses must be held to the same legal standards as cars or taxis.

attributes.action: Ban, male only,  gender segregated, activities in all UK  sports facilities.
attributes.background: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths and segregated in smaller community baths.
attributes.additional_details: Women are BANNED from 'men-only' sessions at Luton's taxpayer-funded Olympic swimming pool 'for cultural reasons' and segregated in smaller community baths.

attributes.action: Stop South Africans voting in UK when Brits can't vote in SA.
attributes.background:
A Brit living in South Africa with permanent residency is prevented from voting in South African elections. However, South Africans can move to the UK and after meeting the residency requirements can vote in all UK elections.
This is grossly unjust and needs to be stopped
attributes.additional_details:
Qualifying Commonwealth citizens can vote in all UK elections once they've been resident for the requisite period but in some Commonwealth countries like South Africa there is no reciprocal agreement. This is blatantly unfair and unjust and must be stopped.

Who can vote in a South African election?
http://www.elections.org.za/content/For-Voters/FAQ--Voter-registration/

Who can vote in a UK election?
http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/faq/voting-and-registration/who-is-eligible-to-vote-at-a-uk-general-election

Qualifying Commonwealth citizens: http://www.electoralcommission.org.uk/__data/assets/electoral_commission_pdf_file/0009/79515/List-of-eligible-countries.pdf

attributes.action: We the 17.5 million Brexit Supporters demand a general election immediately
attributes.background: Teresa May is stalling the process, meeting with Brussels, Angela Merkel and The First Minister of Scotland, and Is also allowing unelected peers to try and block Brexit, she is not honouring her pledge that Brexit means Brexit, she was not elected by the people of the UK

attributes.action: Reform of the UK's honours system, reflecting achievement, not money donated.
attributes.background:
The honours system has become discredited to the point that highest bidders win high honours, irrespective of their achievements and merit to the country.

Honours should only be given for real, tangible, honourable acts or achievements - not for political donations or doing a Whitehall job.
attributes.additional_details:
It seems incredulous that people are given knighthoods for doing Whitehall jobs they have been handsomely paid for anyway, yet doctors, nurses, consultants, teachers, firefighters, police etc all struggle to get recognition for saving lives and transforming society.

Handing honours to people who have helped individuals achieve office by money or political manoeuvring is sheer cronyism; the current system must now be overhauled to stop its dishonourable use and restore its proper status.

attributes.action: Investigate the fiscal soundness of every PFI contract current in the UK.
attributes.background: There is growing concern that the widespread use of PFI by successive Governments may have created a disproportionate financial stress on public services to the detriment of all.  A thorough investigation is therefore warranted.
attributes.additional_details: n/a

attributes.action: Make a UK-wide ban on the use of artifical colourings in medication.
attributes.background:
Artifical colouring agents are often unnecessarily used in medication to effect a particular appearance rather than for any significant gain or change in the effectiveness of medications. 
As one of many people prone to allergic reactions to colourings E102-E133 I request a ban from medication use.
attributes.additional_details:
Artifical colourings can make it greatly difficult for those sensetive to find even basic medication without adverse effects.  Examples of which are calcium supplements containing brilliant blue E133 and antibiotics such as amoxicillin containing sunset yellow E110

Reactions in those allergic can range from migraines and photosensitivity,  hypersensitivity,  vomiting & in my personal experience with E133 rash,  nausea, swelling of throat and disorientation. These are unacceptable & unnecessary

attributes.action: Drivers over 60 to take a mini driving test
attributes.background: Drivers over the age of 60 to take a mini test, due to them having slow reaction times .
attributes.additional_details: As we age, we slow down. I think that drivers over the age of 60 should have to take a mini test. There are way to many old drivers causing accidents due to due care and attention.A mini test every five years would lesson the amount of accidents caused by people over 60.

attributes.action: Free First Aid courses
attributes.background: First Aid courses should be available for free as it is a life skill which all of the public should know. This will encourage the public to be good citizens and respect their society.

attributes.action: Stop doctors charging for signing cremation form
attributes.background: £168 for a dr to sign cremation form

attributes.action: Limit the cost of mandatory insurance policies, i.e. motor insurance.
attributes.background: It is immoral to charge people inflated premiums when it is the law to ensure you have the insurance in place.
attributes.additional_details: Insurance companies use statistics to seperate and ultimately increase charges applied to different parts of the population. More specifically it should be illegal to increase the motor insurance of someone for having an accident which wasn't their fault. If your no claims bonus had increased your premium must drop.

attributes.action: Ban personal and commercial drone flights over residential properties
attributes.background: ​Following the recent approval from The Civil Aviation Authority (CAA) granted to Amazon to test its aerial vehicles without several of the flying restrictions rules, we the undersigned seek to ban all drone flights at any height over residential properties and privately owned land.
attributes.additional_details: With the usage of drones by hobbyists, individuals and organisations on the increase we are concerned that privacy will be compromised, and catching any offenders will be near impossible. The risk of harm through drone faults will increase. Drones will be used by criminals to spy and transport illegal items. Noise pollution will increase and it will no doubt cause many homeowners to feel uncomfortable & insecure in their own back garden.

attributes.action: Only allow supermarkets to have ONE isle for junk food (eg crisps and sweets)
attributes.background: Junk food is bad for us and causes many health problems so we need to cut down on the amount of junk foods avalible in shops. One way of doing this is instead of having one isle for chocolate and sweets in the supermarket and another for crisps only- we have one isle for them all.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.nhs.uk/livewell/goodfood/pages/sugars.aspx

attributes.action: Take down all "no ball games" signs; children should be outside having fun!
attributes.background: The government needs to review the use of "no ball games" signs throughout the country. We are at a cross-roads, we either allow child obesity to continue at its epidemic rate, or encourage children to play and exercise as much as possible to bring these rates down.

attributes.action: DVLA website services to be available 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
attributes.background: The DVLA website is only open Monday to Saturday 8am and 6pm to deal with certain issues (for example, telling them when you have bought or sold a vehicle). This is ridiculous. A website should be open 24 hours, seven days a week. There is no reason for it not to be.
attributes.additional_details: This affects us all by making it more difficult for us by forcing us to deal with matters during these specific times and not in evenings/outside office hours. The Government is here to serve us, the people, not the other way round. This is an example of self serving bureaucracy gone wrong. It's also wasteful, as it encourages people to deal with the matter by post instead of using the website. This wastes paper (and therefore kills trees) and creates unnecessary administration costs.

attributes.action: Close schools when temperature reaches 30 Degrees Celsius.
attributes.background:
Should schools be closed in a heat wave?
Students are forced to remain at school in uncomfortable weather conditions, following their strict school uniform or business wear in sixth forms. These high, uncomfortable weather conditions enable individuals to feeling distracted and lose concentration.
attributes.additional_details:
Teachers also claim that  young individuals can become lethargic and less likely to concentrate. however, within hot weather conditions, students and teachers are also likely to faint.

Schools are due to break up for the summer holidays within the next week, but in the meantime many children are coping with “hot and stuffy” classrooms. And, should be shut within atrocious weather conditions. In addition, some schools do not have air conditioning systems or do not use them as they are costly.

attributes.action: ARM must remain a majority UK owned company.
attributes.background: ARM is probably the most successful UK Tech Company. Ownership of this vital sector is disappearing into foreign hands at an alarming rate. The UK Government should hold a golden share.
attributes.additional_details: Theresa May the new Prime Minister has just said some UK vital companies may be protected. ARM is one of these. This should be debated in Parliament at the earliest opportunity.

attributes.action: Ban and prevent the sale of Microtransactions and DlC in games and apps.
attributes.background: Corporations within the gaming , mobile and software industry have become to big and greedy. Exploiting consumers for all of their money and making 100% profit from Microtransactions. Often making money off non existent things such as virtual currency. Also protecting people who have massive bills.
attributes.additional_details:
http://venturebeat.com/2014/02/21/report-finds-free-to-play-microtransactions-make-up-79-of-u-s-app-store-revenues/ 

http://www.moneysavingexpert.com/news/phones/2013/02/kids-spent-3200-iphone-avoid-app-charge-hell 

http://www.gamesindustry.biz/articles/2016-03-02-eas-ultimate-team-earning-around-usd650-million-a-year 

http://uk.businessinsider.com/microtransactions-are-ruining-video-games-2015-4

attributes.action: Make it tougher for foreign buyers to purchase UK properties
attributes.background: Places like Denmark, Singapore, Hong Kong, Switzerland & Australia have made it much tougher or more expensive for foreign buyers to snap up homes. However, UK still allows foreigners to buy and sell properties as they wish, making profits but pushing up prices which many UK families cannot afford.
attributes.additional_details:
We ask that the needs of the British people be met first. A lot of foreign investment properties are empty when British workers are finding it harder and harder to even rent a place. 

Currently UK property developers like to pre-sell their developments to overseas buyers because, unlike UK buyers, they pay a deposit of 20% even before the project has started. It helps to finance their projects but makes Brits second priority.

attributes.action: Ban barbeque's within built up and residential areas in the UK
attributes.background: I find it extremely offensive to have to breath in smoke of any kind bellowing from a neighbors garden.The smell gets into my laundry that I hang outside and also my upholstery/bedding. It stinks my entire home out which also means theres no chance that I can enjoy an evening in my own garden.
attributes.additional_details: I haven't eaten meat for 27 years so I am fully evolved and for that reason barbeque's are extremely offensive to someone like myself and why should I have to put of with this smell in my home?Even if I wasn't a Vegan I would still find smoke bellowing through my home unacceptable.Please help me to ban barbecues within built up and residential areas in the UK
